document.docAuthor: Domahovski, Alexandre Cruz & Cavichioli, Rodney Ramiro
document.docTitle: Polana (Varpulana) naja Domahovski & Cavichioli, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 32–43.
P.
(F.) intricata
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 32, head and thorax, dorsal view. 33, head, frontal view. 34, head and thorax, lateral view. 35, forewing. 36–43, male terminalia: 36, sternite VIII, ventral view. 37, pygofer, valve and subgenital plate, lateral view. 38, apex of pygofer, ventral view. 39, subgenital plate, ventral view. 40, style and connective, dorsal view. 41, style, lateral view. 42, aedeagus, lateral view. 43, aedeagus dorsal view. Scale bars: 32–34 = 1.0 mm, 35 = 2.0 mm, 36–37 = 0.5 mm, 38–43 = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 44–55.
P.
(F.) naja
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 44, head and thorax, dorsal view. 45, head, frontal view. 46, head and thorax, lateral view. 47, forewing. 48–55, male terminalia: 48, sternite VIII, ventral view. 49, pygofer, valve and subgenital plate, lateral view. 50, apex of pygofer, ventral view. 51, subgenital plate, ventral view. 52, style and connective, dorsal view. 53, style, lateral view. 54, aedeagus, lateral view. 55, aedeagus posterior view. Scale bars: 44–46 = 1.0 mm, 47 = 2.0 mm, 48–4 9 = 0.5 mm, 50–55 = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 56–59.
P.
(F.) naja
sp. nov.
, female paratype terminalia: 56, sternite VII and pygofer, ventral view. 57, pygofer and valvulae, lateral view. 58, first valvifer and first valvulae, lateral view. 59, second valvulae, lateral view. Scale bars: 56 = 1.0 mm, 57–59 = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The new species name refers to the shape of the aedeagus in posterior view, which resembles an elapid snake of the genus
Naja .

Material examined. Holotype male:
" Brasil , Minas Gerais ,\ Itamarandiba-\ aeroporto
09–16.II.2013
\ Malaise \ G. Melo leg." ( DZUP )
;

♂, same data as the holotype ( DZUP )

Remarks.
Polana (V.) naja
sp. nov.
is most similar to
P. (V.) sapitanduva
sp. nov.
in having the aedeagal shaft, elongated and curved with a pair of short processes on the posterior surface. However, the new species can be easily separated from other species of Varpulana by the very short and membranous atrial processes and the aedeagal shaft with apex flattened in lateral view and wide in posterior view.
